Name: relacl
Description: access privileges; see the descriptions of grant and revoke for details.

Name: relam
Description: if this is an index, the access method used (b-tree, hash, etc.)

Name: relchecks
Description: number of check constraints on the table; see pg_constraint catalog

Name: relfilenode
Description: name of the on-disk file of this relation; 0 if none

Name: relfkeys
Description: unused (not the number of foreign keys on the table)

Name: relhasindex
Description: true if this is a table and it has (or recently had) any indexes. this is set by create index, but not cleared immediately by drop index. vacuum clears relhasindex if it finds the table has no indexes.

Name: relhasoids
Description: true if we generate an oid for each row of the relation.

Name: relhaspkey
Description: true if the table has (or once had) a primary key.

Name: relhasrules
Description: table has rules; see pg_rewrite catalog

Name: relhassubclass
Description: at least one table inherits from this one

Name: relisshared
Description: true if this table is shared across all databases in the cluster. only certain system catalogs (such as pg_database) are shared.

Name: relkind
Description: r = ordinary table, i = index, s = sequence, v = view, c = composite type, s = special, t = toast table

Name: relname
Description: name of the table, index, view, etc.

Name: relnamespace
Description: the oid of the namespace that contains this relation

Name: relnatts
Description: number of user columns in the relation (system columns not counted). there must be this many corresponding entries in pg_attribute. see also pg_attribute.attnum.

Name: relowner
Description: owner of the relation

Name: relpages
Description: size of the on-disk representation of this table in pages (size blcksz). this is only an estimate used by the planner. it is updated by vacuum, analyze, and create index.

Name: relrefs
Description: unused

Name: reltoastidxid
Description: for a toast table, the oid of its index. 0 if not a toast table.

Name: reltoastrelid
Description: oid of the toast table associated with this table, 0 if none. the toast table stores large attributes "out of line" in a secondary table.

Name: reltriggers
Description: number of triggers on the table; see pg_trigger catalog

Name: reltuples
Description: number of rows in the table. this is only an estimate used by the planner. it is updated by vacuum, analyze, and create index.

Name: reltype
Description: the oid of the data type that corresponds to this table, if any (zero for indexes, which have no pg_type entry)

Name: relukeys
Description: unused (not the number of unique keys)
